title: Add 'only running' option to cli pipeline status'
User Accounts & Authentication

Includes: user registration and login (email/password, OAuth), session management (JWT or session cookies), user profile page, password reset flow, API authentication middleware.

title: Paper Trading System
description:
Implement paper trading for users to simulate trades against real market data.

## Requirements

### Trade Execution
- Buy/sell interface on company pages
- Market orders (execute at current price) and limit orders
- Position sizing (shares, dollar amount)
- Commission simulation (configurable, default /usr/bin/zsh)

### Portfolio Management
- Portfolio dashboard showing all positions
- Per-position: ticker, shares, avg cost, current value, unrealized P&L, % return
- Portfolio summary: total value, total P&L, daily change
- Trade history with realized P&L

### Storage Strategy
- **Phase 1:** IndexedDB (browser-local, like osrs-flips) — works without user accounts
- **Phase 2:** Server-side storage when user accounts (symbology-00n) land
  - New tables: paper_portfolios, paper_trades
  - API endpoints for CRUD operations

### Trade Lifecycle
1. **Pending** - Order placed, awaiting fill (limit orders)
2. **Active** - Position held, tracking unrealized P&L
3. **Closed** - Position sold, realized P&L recorded

### Features
- Starting cash balance (configurable, default ,000)
- Cash tracking (available balance after open positions)
- Trade notes/tags for tracking strategies
- Export trade history to CSV
- Performance metrics: Sharpe ratio, win rate, avg gain/loss

### State Management
- Svelte 5 rune-based store (like osrs-flips/trade-store.svelte.ts)
- Browser detection for SSR safety
- Reactive updates on trade mutations

## Reference
- osrs-flips/ui/src/lib/stores/trade-store.svelte.ts - Trade store pattern
- osrs-flips/ui/src/routes/portfolio/ - Portfolio UI
- osrs-flips/ui/src/lib/server/db/portfolio.ts - IndexedDB operations

title: Downgrade single summaries from Sonnet to Haiku
description: Change single_summary model in PIPELINE_MODEL_CONFIGS from claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929 to claude-haiku-4-5-20251001. Before switching, run a side-by-side comparison: generate Haiku single summaries for 1-2 companies and diff against existing Sonnet outputs. If quality is acceptable, ship the change. Est. savings: ~10x cost reduction on ~80% of LLM calls. Files: server/symbology/worker/pipeline.py (L17-21)

title: Financial Data Temporal Comparison
description:
Year-over-year comparison view for structured financial data (balance sheets, income statements). Show how a company's financial position has changed across filing periods.

## Scope
- Extract and store key financial metrics from filings (or source from existing document data)
- UI view: side-by-side or table comparing financial line items across 2+ periods
- Visual indicators for significant changes (growth, decline, new items)
- Initially scoped to balance sheet data from 10-K filings

## Out of Scope
- Generated content temporal comparison (see timeline backlog item)
- Automated trend narrative generation (future enhancement)
close_reason: Implemented all 5 subtasks: pipeline wiring, CLI fix, temporal comparison query, API endpoint, and comparison UI

title: Technical Analysis Engine
description:
Implement technical analysis and signal computation in Go.

## Indicators to Implement

### Moving Averages
- SMA (Simple Moving Average) - 20, 50, 200 period
- EMA (Exponential Moving Average) - 12, 26 period
- Bollinger Bands (20-period SMA ± 2 std dev)

### Momentum Indicators
- RSI (Relative Strength Index) - 14-period, Wilder's smoothing
  - Signal on RSI < 30 (oversold) or > 70 (overbought)
- MACD (12/26/9) - Bullish/bearish crossover detection
  - Mean reversion multiplier when price deviates from SMA
- Stochastic Oscillator (%K, %D)

### Volume Analysis
- Volume-weighted average price (VWAP)
- On-Balance Volume (OBV)
- Volume spike detection (current vs N-period average)

### Pattern Detection
- Support/resistance levels
- Price breakouts (above resistance / below support)
- Golden/death cross (50/200 SMA crossover)

## Architecture
- Signal computer runs on configurable interval (e.g. every 5 minutes)
- Reads from 1h bucket table for indicator calculation
- Stores signals in signals table with JSONB metadata and TTL
- Each signal: item_id, signal_type, score (0-1), metadata, created_at, expires_at
- Unique constraint per (company_id, signal_type) — latest signal wins

## Configuration
- Enable/disable individual indicators
- Configurable periods and thresholds
- Minimum data points required before computing (e.g. 35 for MACD)

## Reference
- osrs-flips/pkg/collector/signal_computer.go - Signal computation patterns
- EMA: k = 2 / (period + 1), price * k + prev * (1 - k)
- RSI: Wilder's smoothing method
- Mean reversion multiplier: 1 + clamp((sma - price) / price * 10)

title: UI: Technical Analysis & Signal Display
description:
Display technical analysis indicators and trading signals in the SvelteKit UI.

## Requirements

### Chart Overlays
- Bollinger Bands overlay (shaded area between upper/lower bands)
- Moving average lines (SMA 20/50/200, color-coded, toggleable)
- MACD subplot (MACD line, signal line, histogram)
- RSI subplot (with overbought/oversold zones highlighted)
- Volume with color coding (up/down days)

### Signal Display
- Signal badges on company page when active signals exist
- Signal detail panel: type, score, metadata, time remaining
- Signal list page (/signals) with filters by type, score threshold
- Signal history timeline (when signals fired and expired)

### Indicator Controls
- Toggle individual indicators on/off
- Adjust parameters (e.g. MA periods) via UI controls
- Persist user preferences (localStorage or user account settings)

### Signal Notifications (stretch)
- Browser notifications for new high-score signals
- Signal feed/ticker on dashboard

## Reference
- osrs-flips/ui/src/routes/signals/ - Signal list display
- osrs-flips/ui/src/routes/items/[id]/ - Signal integration on detail page

title: Redis Caching Layer
description: Add Redis for caching frequently accessed data to reduce database load. Includes: Redis service in docker-compose, cache decorator/middleware for API routes, cache company search results, cache generated content by hash, cache invalidation strategy, cache hit/miss metrics.

title: TimescaleDB Schema & Infrastructure
description:
Set up TimescaleDB for multi-resolution price data storage.

## Requirements

- Enable TimescaleDB extension on the existing PostgreSQL instance (or provision a dedicated instance)
- Create hypertables mirroring the osrs-flips pattern:

### Hypertables
- **price_observations** - Raw tick/quote data (short retention: 7 days)
  - Columns: company_id, observed_at, open, high, low, close, volume
  - Partitioned by observed_at
- **price_buckets_5m** - 5-minute OHLCV aggregates (retention: 7-30 days)
- **price_buckets_1h** - Hourly OHLCV aggregates (retention: 1 year)  
- **price_buckets_24h** - Daily OHLCV aggregates (retention: forever, compressed after 30 days)

### Supporting Tables
- **signals** - Trading signals with JSONB metadata, TTL-based expiry
- **sync_metadata** - Track sync state, gaps, and no-data timestamps

### Policies
- Retention policies per hypertable tier
- Compression policy on 24h buckets (chunks > 30 days)
- Indexes on (company_id, bucket_start) for each bucket table

## Reference
- osrs-flips/migrations/ - Schema patterns and retention policy setup
- Key difference: use company_id (UUID FK to companies table) instead of integer item_id

## Notes
- Decide whether to use same PostgreSQL instance or separate. Same instance is simpler but consider load isolation.
- Alembic (Python) won't manage these migrations — use golang-migrate or standalone SQL scripts

title: Real-Time Market Data, Technical Analysis & Paper Trading
description:
Port the real-time price ingestion, technical analysis, charting, and paper trading capabilities from osrs-flips to symbology. Introduces a Go backend service for market data alongside the existing Python/FastAPI backend, with TimescaleDB for time-series price storage. The SvelteKit UI will serve from both backends during the transition period, with an eventual full Go API migration planned.

## Architecture Overview

- **Go service** handles price data ingestion, technical analysis, and market data API
- **TimescaleDB** (PostgreSQL extension) stores multi-resolution price data in hypertables
- **Existing Python backend** continues to serve SEC filing/company data
- **SvelteKit UI** communicates with both backends via Caddy reverse proxy
- **Paper trading** for users to simulate trades against real market data

## Data Flow

1. Go poller fetches real-time quotes from market data provider (e.g. Polygon, Alpha Vantage)
2. Raw observations stored in TimescaleDB hypertable with short retention
3. Aggregated into 5m/1h/24h buckets with progressively longer retention
4. Signal engine computes technical indicators (MACD, RSI, moving averages)
5. Go API serves price/chart/signal data to SvelteKit frontend
6. UI renders charts via LayerChart (D3-based, already used in osrs-flips)

## Phases

1. **Foundation** - TimescaleDB schema, Go service scaffold, Caddy routing
2. **Data Pipeline** - Market data ingestion, multi-resolution aggregation, API endpoints
3. **Technical Analysis** - Signal engine (MACD, RSI, crossovers), indicator storage
4. **UI: Charts & Signals** - Price charts on company pages, indicator overlays, signal display
5. **Paper Trading** - Trade execution, portfolio management, P&L tracking
6. **API Migration** - Gradual migration of Python API endpoints to Go

## Reference Implementation

osrs-flips (~/osrs-flips) serves as the reference architecture:
- pkg/collector/ - Poller, background sync, signal computation patterns
- pkg/storage/ - TimescaleDB query patterns, hypertable management
- ui/src/lib/components/charts/ - LayerChart integration patterns
- ui/src/lib/stores/trade-store.svelte.ts - Paper trading state management
- migrations/ - TimescaleDB schema with retention policies and compression

title: Market Data REST API (Go)
description:
Expose price and market data via Go REST API.

## Endpoints

### Price Data
- GET /api/prices/{ticker}/latest - Current quote (price, volume, change, change_pct)
- GET /api/prices/{ticker}/history?from=&to=&resolution= - Historical OHLCV
  - Resolution: 5m, 1h, 1d (maps to bucket tables)
  - Default: 1d, last 1 year
- GET /api/prices/{ticker}/intraday - Today's intraday data (from observations)

### Batch Endpoints  
- GET /api/prices/batch?tickers=AAPL,MSFT,GOOG - Latest quotes for multiple tickers
- GET /api/prices/movers?type=gainers|losers&limit=10 - Top movers

### Signals
- GET /api/signals/{ticker} - Active signals for a ticker
- GET /api/signals?type=macd_crossover|rsi_oversold - All active signals by type
- GET /api/signals/summary - Signal counts and overview

### Data Health
- GET /api/prices/{ticker}/coverage - Data availability and gap info
- GET /api/health - Service health with data freshness metrics

## Requirements
- JSON responses with consistent envelope (data, meta, pagination)
- CORS headers for SvelteKit frontend access
- Request validation and meaningful error responses
- Query parameter parsing for date ranges, resolution, pagination
- OpenAPI spec generation for TypeScript type generation (match existing pattern)

## Reference
- osrs-flips/pkg/storage/query_repository.go - Query patterns (DISTINCT ON, aggregations)
- osrs-flips/pkg/osrs/datasource.go - Data source abstraction (DB + API fallback)
- symbology/server/symbology/api/ - Response patterns to align with

title: Refactor CompanyGroup to internal-only Groups (drop group_type enum)
description:
Simplify the CompanyGroup model to be an internal/system-managed concept only ("Groups"), removing the group_type enum and custom type. Watchlists will become a dedicated separate model when symbology-rit is implemented.

## Changes Required

### Database / Model
- Rename `CompanyGroup` → consider just `Group` or keep `CompanyGroup`
- Drop `group_type` enum column and `CompanyGroupType` enum (`sector`/`custom`)
- Drop `owner_id` column (user ownership moves to future Watchlist model)
- Keep: name, slug, description, sic_codes, membership table, search_vector
- Migration to drop the enum column and owner_id

### API
- Simplify `/groups` endpoints — remove `group_type` query parameter
- Update `CompanyGroupResponse` schema — remove `group_type` field

### CLI
- Remove `--type` flag from `group create` and `--type` filter from `group list`

### Pipeline / Worker
- No changes needed (already references groups by slug, not type)

### UI
- Routes stay at `/sectors` (or rename to `/groups` — decide)
- Remove any group_type filtering logic in data loaders

### Seed Data
- Add a CLI command or CSV to bootstrap standard sector groups (Tech, Healthcare, Energy, etc.) with SIC codes
- This was discussed but never implemented

### Terminology
- Settle on consistent naming across the stack: "group" in code, "sector" in UI (or unify)

## Context
- Original model (symbology-bdx) tried to serve both sectors and watchlists via a shared CompanyGroup with group_type enum
- Decision: split them — Groups are internal/system-managed, Watchlists (symbology-rit) will be a separate user-owned model later
notes: Naming decision: Keep model as CompanyGroup in code, use /groups for API routes. UI routes should also move to /groups for consistency.
close_reason: Dropped group_type enum and owner_id from CompanyGroup model, API, CLI, and UI. Migration added. Routes renamed /sectors → /groups.

title: Improved Search & Discovery
description:
Replace basic LIKE queries with PostgreSQL full-text search across companies, filings, and generated content.

## Approach
- PostgreSQL tsvector columns + GIN indexes (no Elasticsearch needed)
- Weighted search vectors: A=names/tickers/summaries, B=display_name/accession/form/descriptions, C=SIC codes
- Database triggers auto-update vectors on INSERT/UPDATE
- Unified `GET /search` endpoint with `UNION ALL` across entity types, ranked by `ts_rank()`
- `websearch_to_tsquery()` for Google-like query syntax
- `ts_headline()` for highlighted result excerpts

## Filters
- Entity type (company, filing, generated_content)
- SIC code / sector
- Form type (10-K, 10-Q, etc.)
- Document type (MDA, RISK_FACTORS, etc.)
- Date range (filing_date / created_at)

## Key Files
- `server/alembic/versions/*_add_fts_search_vectors.py` (new migration)
- `server/symbology/database/search.py` (new unified search module)
- `server/symbology/api/routes/search.py` (new search endpoint)
- `server/symbology/api/schemas.py` (SearchResultItem, SearchResponse)
- `server/symbology/database/companies.py` (update search_companies_by_query to use FTS)
- `server/symbology/database/{companies,filings,generated_content}.py` (add search_vector columns)
close_reason: Full-text search implemented: PostgreSQL tsvector/GIN indexes, unified search API endpoint, dedicated /search page with filters, enhanced CompanySelector, openapi-typescript type generation, actual token display.

title: Track input/output tokens from API response
description: The Anthropic API returns message.usage.input_tokens and message.usage.output_tokens — we currently ignore these. Steps: (1) Update AnthropicResponseAdapter to capture input_tokens and output_tokens from API response, (2) Add input_tokens and output_tokens columns to generated_content table (new Alembic migration), (3) Store token counts alongside each generated content record, (4) Add a CLI command or API endpoint to report token usage per pipeline run. Enables data-driven optimization and cost attribution per pipeline stage. Files: server/symbology/llm/client.py (L16-24), server/symbology/database/generated_content.py
close_reason: Added input_tokens/output_tokens to AnthropicResponseAdapter, GeneratedContent model, Alembic migration, handlers, and CLI output

title: UI: Price Charts & Market Data Display
description:
Add interactive price charts and market data to the SvelteKit frontend.

## Requirements

### Chart Library

- Components: Area fills, Spline lines, Bar (volume), Bisect-x tooltips
- Responsive sizing, light/dark theme support
- Handle data gaps gracefully (market closed periods)

### Data Fetching

- Server-side data loading in +page.server.ts for initial render
- Client-side updates for real-time quote refresh
- Environment config for Go API URL (PUBLIC_PRICES_API_HOST/PORT)

### Chart Components to Build
- PriceChart.svelte - Main OHLCV chart with overlays
- VolumeChart.svelte - Volume bars (can be embedded or standalone)
- MiniSparkline.svelte - Small inline chart for lists/tables
- PriceHeader.svelte - Current price display with change indicators

### Additional Views

- Price comparison (overlay multiple tickers)

## Reference
- osrs-flips/ui/src/lib/components/charts/ - LayerChart integration patterns
- osrs-flips/ui/src/routes/items/[id]/ - Multi-resolution chart with source selection
- symbology/ui/src/lib/api.ts - Existing API client pattern to extend

title: Diff-based pipeline: skip unchanged sections, diff-summarize the rest
description:
Use raw source document diffs across filing periods to both reduce and eliminate LLM calls. Since SEC filings have high YoY textual overlap, diffing the raw text (post-normalization) enables two optimizations in one:

1. **Skip unchanged sections entirely** — If a section (e.g. controls_procedures) is identical or near-identical across periods, skip the Haiku call and reuse the prior summary. This replaces the need for a separate complexity router (symbology-pxz).

2. **Diff-based single summaries** — For sections that did change, send Haiku the most recent filing's full text + structured diffs for prior periods instead of full text for every period. Reduces Haiku input tokens at the highest-volume pipeline stage.

Steps:
(1) Implement text diff utility for raw filing documents across periods (character-level or line-level similarity score + human-readable diff)
(2) Add similarity threshold — below threshold, reuse prior summary; above threshold, generate with diff-formatted input
(3) Make thresholds configurable per document type (controls_procedures can have a high reuse threshold since it's typically formulaic)
(4) Update single-summary prompts to handle diff-formatted input
(5) Compare output quality and token savings against current full-text approach

Prerequisite: symbology-qyh (normalized text makes diffing reliable).
Files: server/symbology/llm/prompts.py, server/symbology/worker/handlers.py, server/symbology/worker/pipeline.py

title: Lower temperature for factual extraction
description: Current default is temperature: 0.8 across all stages — too high for deterministic factual extraction. Change to: single summaries 0.2, aggregate summaries 0.3, frontpage summaries 0.3. Est. savings: indirect (better outputs, less variance, fewer retries). Files: server/symbology/worker/pipeline.py, server/symbology/utils/config.py
close_reason: Closed

title: Sector & Cross-Company Analysis
description:
Generate aggregate summaries across groups of companies (by sector, industry, or custom grouping) to surface common trends, risks, and opportunities in the broader landscape.

## Company Groups Model
A reusable 'company group' abstraction that supports:
- System-defined sector groups (e.g., 'Tech Giants', 'Auto Manufacturers') based on SIC codes
- Future: user-defined custom groups (watchlists, symbology-rit)

The group model should be designed so watchlists (symbology-rit) can extend it with user ownership later.

## Sector Analysis Pipeline
- Select a group of companies
- Gather their latest aggregate summaries
- Generate a cross-company analysis identifying: common themes, divergent risks, sector-wide opportunities, outliers
- Store as a new generated_content document_type (e.g., 'sector_analysis')

## UI
- Sector/group listing page
- Sector detail page showing the cross-company analysis with links to individual companies
- Group composition (which companies are in the group)
close_reason: Implemented in cf5b214 and 1e21896

title: Go Service Scaffold & Infrastructure
description:
Bootstrap the Go backend service for market data.

## Requirements

### Project Structure (under server/prices/ or a top-level go/ directory)
- cmd/prices/ - Main entry point
- pkg/collector/ - Price data collection (poller, background sync)
- pkg/analysis/ - Technical analysis engine
- pkg/storage/ - Database layer (pgxpool, query repository)
- pkg/api/ - REST API handlers
- migrations/ - golang-migrate SQL migrations

### Infrastructure
- Multi-stage Dockerfile (Go 1.24-alpine → static binary → alpine runtime)
- Add to symbology-compose.yaml as symbology-prices service (port 3002)
- Add Caddy route: prices.symbology.online → symbology-prices:3002
- Health check endpoint at /health
- Structured JSON logging (match existing Python logging format)

### Database Connection
- pgxpool connection pool to shared PostgreSQL/TimescaleDB
- Read access to companies table for ticker resolution
- Full access to price_* and signals tables

### Configuration
- Environment variable based (DATABASE_URL, PORT, LOG_LEVEL, MARKET_DATA_API_KEY)
- Optional config.yml for job definitions (poll intervals, retention policies)

### Dependencies (from osrs-flips patterns)
- github.com/jackc/pgx/v5 - PostgreSQL driver
- github.com/golang-migrate/migrate - Schema migrations
- golang.org/x/time/rate - Rate limiting
- github.com/sirupsen/logrus - Structured logging
- net/http or chi router for API

## Reference
- osrs-flips/cmd/collector/ - Entry point pattern
- osrs-flips/infra/Dockerfile - Multi-stage build pattern
- osrs-flips/pkg/database/ - Connection pool setup

title: Background Job Queue
description: Implement async job processing for long-running tasks like ingestion and content generation. Includes: job queue infrastructure (Celery, or arq, or similar), worker processes for ingestion and LLM generation, job status tracking and reporting, retry logic with dead letter queue, admin UI or CLI for job management.
close_reason: Implemented full background job queue: PostgreSQL-native queue with SELECT FOR UPDATE SKIP LOCKED, worker process with signal handling, API endpoints, CLI commands, real job handlers for ingestion/content-generation, deployment config. 47 new tests, all 227 pass.

title: We need to update our rate limiting on the anthropic api - we have backoff but it caps at 1min, should be 2-3
Market Data Ingestion Pipeline
description:
Implement real-time and historical market data collection in Go.

## Requirements

### Data Source Selection
- Evaluate providers: Polygon.io (recommended - WebSocket + REST, good free tier), Alpha Vantage, Yahoo Finance, Finnhub
- Implement provider abstraction (interface) to allow swapping sources
- Rate limiting and ToS compliance per provider

### Real-Time Poller
- Poll latest quotes at configurable interval (e.g. every 60s during market hours)
- Fetch quotes for all tracked companies in batch where possible
- Store raw observations in price_observations hypertable
- Use COPY protocol for efficient bulk inserts (pgx CopyFrom)
- Market hours awareness (9:30 AM - 4:00 PM ET, weekdays, holidays)

### Historical Backfill
- Background sync for historical daily data (years of history)
- Backfill intraday data where available (provider-dependent)
- Gap detection and prioritized fill (like osrs-flips background_sync.go)
- Track no-data timestamps to avoid redundant API calls

### Aggregation
- Aggregate raw observations into 5m/1h buckets
- 24h buckets from daily close data
- Handle market hours correctly (buckets aligned to trading sessions)

### Company Tracking
- Read from companies table to determine which tickers to track
- Support adding/removing tickers dynamically
- Initially: track S&P 500 companies (symbology already has sp500.csv)

## Reference
- osrs-flips/pkg/collector/poller.go - Polling pattern
- osrs-flips/pkg/collector/background_sync.go - Historical backfill
- osrs-flips/pkg/collector/volume_poller.go - Per-item volume tracking
- osrs-flips/pkg/osrs/client.go - API client with rate limiting

title: Automated Data Pipeline
description: Automate ingestion of new SEC filings as they appear on EDGAR, replacing the current manual CLI-driven process. Includes: scheduled polling of EDGAR for new filings, automatic document extraction and LLM content generation, background job queue for async processing, monitoring and alerting for pipeline failures.
close_reason: All subtasks complete: orchestration, job handler, run tracking, scheduler, monitoring, and justfile/compose wiring

title: Pipeline orchestration helpers
description: Create server/symbology/worker/pipeline.py with shared utilities: ensure_model_config(name, num_ctx) to create-or-return ModelConfig, ensure_prompt(prompt_name) to load from prompts/ dir and create-or-return Prompt. These replace the CLI model-configs create / prompts create calls used in ingest.just.
close_reason: Closed

title: FULL_PIPELINE job type, handler, and migration
description: Add FULL_PIPELINE to JobType enum in database/jobs.py. Add handle_full_pipeline handler in worker/handlers.py that orchestrates the full ingest.just logic in Python: (1) company ingestion, (2) filing ingestion with documents, (3) for each document_type x accession_number create single summary via CONTENT_GENERATION, (4) aggregate summary from all singles, (5) frontpage summary from aggregate. Uses pipeline helpers for model config/prompt resolution. Params: {ticker, forms, count, document_types}. Add Alembic migration to extend job_type_enum.
close_reason: Closed

title: Pipeline run tracking model
description: Create server/symbology/database/pipeline_runs.py with PipelineRun model: id (uuid7), company_id (FK), trigger (MANUAL/SCHEDULED enum), status (PENDING/RUNNING/COMPLETED/FAILED/PARTIAL enum), forms (ARRAY[str]), started_at, completed_at, error (Text), jobs_created (int), jobs_completed (int), jobs_failed (int), metadata (JSON). Add CRUD functions. Add Alembic migration. Integrate with FULL_PIPELINE handler: create PipelineRun at start, update on completion/failure, track partial success.
close_reason: Closed

title: Scheduler module with EDGAR polling
description: Create server/symbology/scheduler/ package: (1) config.py - SchedulerSettings (pydantic-settings, env prefix SCHEDULER_): poll_interval (default 21600s/6hr), enabled_forms (default [10-K, 10-Q]), filing_lookback_days (default 30). (2) polling.py - check_company_for_new_filings(ticker, forms, lookback_days) queries EDGAR and compares accession numbers vs DB; poll_all_companies() iterates all companies and enqueues FULL_PIPELINE jobs for those with new filings. (3) main.py - long-lived process with graceful shutdown (SIGTERM/SIGINT), periodic poll loop with time.sleep, stale run detection. Same pattern as worker/main.py.
close_reason: Closed

title: Monitoring API, CLI, and alerting
description: API routes (server/symbology/api/routes/pipeline.py): GET /pipeline/runs (list with filters), GET /pipeline/runs/{id} (detail with linked jobs), GET /pipeline/status (dashboard: last run per company, failures, next poll), POST /pipeline/trigger/{ticker} (manual trigger). CLI commands (server/symbology/cli/pipeline.py): pipeline status, pipeline trigger TICKER, pipeline runs. Failure alerting (server/symbology/scheduler/alerts.py): detect consecutive failures per company, stale RUNNING runs; alert via structured log events; optional webhook URL config for Slack/Discord.
design:
## Implementation Plan

### New Files
- api/routes/pipeline.py — 4 API routes (list runs, get run, status dashboard, manual trigger)
- cli/pipeline.py — CLI commands (pipeline status, trigger, runs)
- scheduler/alerts.py — Alert detection + webhook dispatch
- Tests for all three

### Modified Files
- schemas.py — PipelineRunResponse, PipelineStatusResponse, CompanyPipelineStatus, PipelineTriggerRequest
- routes/__init__.py — Register /pipeline router
- main.py (api) — Add pipeline openapi tag
- main.py (cli) — Register pipeline command group
- pipeline_runs.py — Add get_latest_run_per_company(), count_consecutive_failures()
- scheduler/config.py — Add alert thresholds + webhook settings (SCHEDULER_ prefix)
- scheduler/main.py — Replace _detect_stale_runs() with check_alerts()

### Logging Convention
- snake_case event names, structured kwargs
- Bounded cardinality: counts not lists, error_type not error_message, url_host not full URL
- Events: alert_consecutive_failures, alert_stale_run, alert_webhook_sent, api_trigger_pipeline, etc.
close_reason: Work already committed in 26a2fc7

title: Justfile and Docker compose wiring
description: Add scheduler recipe to server/justfile: uv run -m symbology.scheduler.main. Add scheduler delegation to root justfile. Add pipeline trigger TICKER recipe. Add scheduler service to symbology-compose.yaml alongside api and worker. Register pipeline router in api/main.py, register pipeline CLI group in cli/main.py.
close_reason: Added run-scheduler and run-pipeline-trigger recipes to root justfile, added symbology-scheduler service to docker compose

title: Interactive Q&A on Filings
description: Allow users to ask natural language questions about a company's filings and get AI-generated answers grounded in the source documents. Includes: chat-style interface on company pages, RAG pipeline to retrieve relevant document sections, source attribution with links to original filing text, conversation history per company.

title: Cloud LLM Provider Support
description: Extend beyond local Ollama to support cloud LLM APIs for higher quality and scalability. Includes: abstract LLM client interface supporting multiple providers, Claude API integration, OpenAI API integration, provider selection per content generation job, cost tracking per generation, fallback chain across providers.

title: Sentiment Scoring & Trends
description: Quantify sentiment from filings and generated content to enable trend analysis. Includes: sentiment scoring model for filing sections, sentiment trend charts over time per company, sector-level sentiment aggregation, sentiment change alerts for significant shifts.

title: Right-size max_tokens per pipeline stage
description: Currently max_tokens: 4096 for all stages including frontpage which asks for ~100 words. Change to: single summaries 2048, aggregate summaries 4096 (keep), frontpage summaries 512. Prevents runaway outputs. Files: server/symbology/worker/pipeline.py (L17-21)
close_reason: Closed

title: Search UI: enhanced CompanySelector + dedicated /search page
description:
Build the search frontend with two integration points.

## Enhanced CompanySelector
- For queries >= 3 chars, call unified `/search` endpoint
- Show results grouped by entity type with badges (Company, Filing, Analysis)
- Navigate to `/c/{ticker}`, `/f/{accession}`, or `/g/{ticker}/{hash}` based on type

## Dedicated Search Page
- `ui/src/routes/search/+page.svelte` + `+page.ts`
- Search input with debounce
- Filter sidebar: entity type checkboxes, SIC code, form type, date range
- Results list with type badges, highlighted excerpts, pagination
- URL state sync (query params for bookmarkable searches)

## Navigation
- Add 'Search' link to `ui/src/lib/components/ui/Navigation.svelte`

## API Client
- Add `search()` function to `ui/src/lib/api.ts`
close_reason: Created /search page with filters (entity type, form type, date range), pagination, result cards. Enhanced CompanySelector with unified search for 3+ char queries. Added Search to navigation.

title: Formalize type sharing between server/ and ui/ (prototype generate api types needs review)
description:
Replace custom `generate-api-types.js` script with `openapi-typescript` to eliminate all `any` types in generated TypeScript interfaces.

## Problem
Current `ui/scripts/generate-api-types.js` has a FIXME: doesn't handle `anyOf`/nullable from Pydantic's OpenAPI output, producing `any` for all Optional fields (display_name, sic, content, filing, etc.).

## Approach
1. Install `openapi-typescript` as dev dependency
2. Replace justfile recipe: `npx openapi-typescript http://localhost:8000/openapi.json -o src/lib/generated-api-types.ts`
3. Create bridge file `ui/src/lib/api-types.ts` that re-exports `components['schemas']['*']` as named types
4. Move runtime utilities (`fetchApi`, `isApiError`, `ApiError`) from generated file to `api-types.ts`
5. Update all imports from `$lib/generated-api-types` to `$lib/api-types`

## Key Files
- `ui/scripts/generate-api-types.js` (can be removed/replaced)
- `ui/src/lib/generated-api-types.ts` (regenerated by openapi-typescript)
- `ui/src/lib/api-types.ts` (new bridge + runtime utils)
- `ui/src/lib/api.ts` (update imports)
- `ui/justfile` (update recipe)
- All .svelte files importing from generated-api-types
close_reason: Replaced custom generate-api-types.js with openapi-typescript. Created api-types.ts bridge file. Updated all imports across 10 files. Zero any types in generated output.

title: update UI to use our refactored types (including token usage display)
description:
Update the UI to use properly typed interfaces and display actual token usage from the server.

## Token Usage
- Server already stores `input_tokens`/`output_tokens` on GeneratedContent (migration d9e3f2a56b8c)
- `GeneratedContentResponse` schema silently drops these fields - need to add them
- Also add missing `form_type` field to the schema
- UI currently estimates tokens: `Math.ceil(content.length / 4)` - replace with actual values
- Graceful fallback to estimation for older content without token data

## Key Files
- `server/symbology/api/schemas.py` (add input_tokens, output_tokens, form_type to GeneratedContentResponse)
- `ui/src/routes/g/[ticker]/[sha]/+page.svelte` (display actual token counts)

## Depends On
- symbology-j46 (type generation) should be done first so new fields are properly typed
close_reason: Added input_tokens/output_tokens/form_type to GeneratedContentResponse schema. Updated g/[ticker]/[sha] page to show actual token usage with fallback to estimate.

title: FTS migration: tsvector columns, GIN indexes, triggers
description:
Alembic migration to add PostgreSQL full-text search infrastructure.

## Changes
- Add `search_vector TSVECTOR` column to: companies, filings, generated_content
- Create GIN indexes: ix_companies_search_vector, ix_filings_search_vector, ix_generated_content_search_vector
- Create trigger functions to auto-update vectors on INSERT/UPDATE
- Backfill existing rows with weighted tsvector data

## Weight Strategy
- A (highest): company name, ticker, content summaries
- B: display_name, accession_number, form type, descriptions
- C: SIC code/description

## Files
- `server/alembic/versions/<hash>_add_fts_search_vectors.py` (new)
- `server/symbology/database/{companies,filings,generated_content}.py` (add search_vector mapped_column)
close_reason: Migration, model columns, triggers all implemented

title: SvelteKit Dual-Backend Integration
description:
Configure the SvelteKit UI to serve data from both the Python (FastAPI) and Go (market data) backends.

## Requirements

### API Client Configuration
- Extend ui/src/lib/config.ts with Go API URL configuration
  - PUBLIC_PRICES_API_HOST / PUBLIC_PRICES_API_PORT environment variables
  - Production: prices.symbology.online
  - Development: localhost:3002
- Create ui/src/lib/prices-api.ts (or extend api.ts) for Go API functions
- Generate TypeScript types from Go API's OpenAPI spec

### Caddy Routing
- Add prices.symbology.online reverse proxy to Caddyfile
- CORS headers matching existing API configuration
- Or: serve both under api.symbology.online with path-based routing (/api/prices/* → Go, rest → Python)

### Server-Side Data Loading
- SvelteKit load functions call both backends in parallel
- Company page: fetch filing data (Python) + price data (Go) simultaneously
- Error isolation: one backend failing shouldn't break the whole page

### Type Safety
- Generate TypeScript types from Go API OpenAPI spec (just generate-api-types pattern)
- Shared type definitions where APIs reference same entities (companies, tickers)

### Development Experience
- justfile recipes for running Go service locally
- Docker compose includes all services for full-stack dev
- Hot reload for Go service (air or similar)

## Reference
- symbology/ui/src/lib/config.ts - Existing API URL construction
- symbology/ui/src/lib/api.ts - Existing fetch wrapper pattern
- symbology/Caddyfile - Existing reverse proxy config

Write a dedicated market risk prompt focused on quantitative disclosures, then re-run market_risk single summaries for one company to validate. Files: server/prompts/market_risk/prompt.md

title: LLM Context & Cost Optimization
description: Reduce Anthropic API costs and improve context utilization in the SEC filing content generation pipeline. Covers config quick-wins, observability, prompt quality, and architectural improvements. See OPTIMIZATION_PLAN.md.
close_reason: All optimization tasks complete: skip duplicates, Haiku downgrade, temperature tuning, max_tokens right-sizing, token tracking, prompt fixes, text normalization. Diff-based pipeline (ad2) split out as independent future feature.

title: Complexity router for short/stable sections
description: controls_procedures is typically very short and formulaic ('management assessed... internal controls are effective'). Running it through the full 3-stage pipeline (7 LLM calls) is wasteful. Steps: (1) Add document-length threshold check before entering pipeline, (2) For short/stable sections, route to single-pass summary instead of single -> aggregate -> frontpage, (3) Make threshold configurable per document type. Est. savings: eliminate ~2/3 of calls for simple sections. Files: server/symbology/worker/handlers.py, server/symbology/worker/pipeline.py
close_reason: Merged into symbology-ad2 — raw document diffs handle both skip-unchanged and diff-summarize cases, replacing the need for a separate complexity router

description: Let users export and share insights. Includes: PDF report generation for individual companies or comparisons, shareable public links for specific generated content, CSV/JSON export of financial data, embeddable widget for generated insights.

title: Alerts & Notifications
description: Notify users when new filings are published or when AI detects significant changes in a company's disclosures. Includes: new filing alerts, significant change detection (e.g. new risk factors), email and/or in-app notification delivery, user notification preferences.

title: Pre-process and normalize filing text before storage
description: Normalize filing text to reduce input tokens by 10-20%. Steps: (1) Collapse excessive whitespace and blank lines, (2) Strip residual HTML entities and formatting artifacts from EDGAR extraction, (3) Normalize Unicode characters (smart quotes, em-dashes, etc.), (4) Apply normalization in ingest_filing_documents before storing content. Files: server/symbology/ingestion/ingestion_helpers.py
close_reason: Implemented normalize_filing_text utility, wired into ingestion pipeline, added 14 unit tests

title: Watchlists & Portfolios
description: Let users create and manage watchlists of companies they want to track. Foundation for personalized experience. Includes: create/edit/delete watchlists, add/remove companies, watchlist dashboard view showing latest insights for tracked companies.
notes: Watchlists will be a dedicated model, separate from CompanyGroup/Groups. The shared abstraction from symbology-bdx is being split — see symbology-7bj.

title: Strengthen the aggregate-summary prompt
description: Currently just: 'Summarize the historical changes in these documents.' Improvements needed: (1) Specify what constitutes a meaningful 'change' (quantitative shifts, strategy pivots, new risks, discontinued segments), (2) Define output structure (chronological vs. thematic), (3) Instruct model to call out when sections are largely unchanged YoY instead of restating stable content. Reduces output variance, focuses synthesis. Files: server/prompts/aggregate-summary/prompt.md
close_reason: Closed

title: Skip LLM calls for already-processed documents
description: Before calling handle_content_generation for single summaries, query for existing generated content matching the same (source_document, system_prompt, model_config) triple. If a match exists, reuse its content_hash and skip the API call. We already have content_hash on documents and generated_content_document_association — just need the pre-check in handle_full_pipeline (handlers.py ~L369-408). Est. savings: 80-100% on re-runs. Files: server/symbology/worker/handlers.py
close_reason: Closed

close_reason: Restructured src/ → server/symbology/ with all 180 tests passing

title: Unified search database module and API endpoint
description:
Create the search backend: database query module + FastAPI route.

## Database Module (`server/symbology/database/search.py`)
- `unified_search()` function using `websearch_to_tsquery()`
- Per-entity subqueries with `ts_rank()` scoring and `ts_headline()` excerpts
- Filters: entity_type, sic, form_type, document_type, date_from, date_to
- `UNION ALL` across entities, ordered by rank, with pagination

## API Route (`server/symbology/api/routes/search.py`)
- `GET /search?q=...&entity_types=...&sic=...&form_type=...&document_type=...&date_from=...&date_to=...&limit=20&offset=0`
- Register at `/search` in routes/__init__.py
- Add search tag in main.py

## Schemas (`server/symbology/api/schemas.py`)
- SearchResultItem: entity_type, id, rank, headline, title, subtitle, date_value
- SearchResponse: results[], total, query

## Also update
- `search_companies_by_query()` in companies.py to use FTS for queries >= 3 chars
close_reason: Search module, API route, schemas, and router registration all implemented

description: Production-harden the API with rate limiting and versioning. Includes: rate limiting middleware (per-IP or per-API-key), /v1/ API prefix for versioning, API deprecation strategy, rate limit headers in responses (X-RateLimit-Remaining etc).

title: Go API Migration Strategy
description:
Plan and begin the gradual migration of the Python FastAPI backend to Go.

## Context
Once the Go market data service is stable, evaluate migrating existing Python API endpoints to Go. The EDGAR ingestion pipeline and LLM content generation will remain in Python.

## Requirements

### Evaluation Criteria
- Performance benchmarks: Go vs Python for read-heavy API endpoints
- Developer experience: maintaining two codebases vs consolidating
- Migration risk: downtime, data consistency, client compatibility

### Migration Candidates (read-heavy, no LLM dependency)
1. /companies - Company search, lookup, pagination
2. /filings - Filing metadata, timelines
3. /financials - Financial data queries (already time-series-like)
4. /search - Full-text search (PostgreSQL FTS works from either language)
5. /documents - Document metadata (not the LLM-generated content)

### Keep in Python
- /generated-content - Tightly coupled to Anthropic LLM pipeline
- /prompts - Prompt template management
- /pipeline - Pipeline orchestration (uses Python worker framework)
- /jobs - Background job management
- CLI tools (symbology.cli) - EDGAR ingestion, pipeline triggers

### Migration Approach
- Implement Go equivalents behind feature flags
- Caddy can route traffic gradually (canary/blue-green)
- Ensure API response compatibility (same JSON schema)
- Run both in parallel, compare responses for validation
- Cut over endpoint by endpoint

### Shared Database Considerations
- Both services read from same PostgreSQL tables
- Need to coordinate schema migrations (who owns what)
- Consider read replicas if load becomes a concern

## This is a P3 planning task — no implementation until market data service is proven
